comment: She does not give clear instructions for assignments, so it is hard to know exactly what she wants us to do. There is no clear grading criteria. She gives little to no feedback on assignments, making it hard to know what you are doing right or wrong. She is a pretty tough grader as well. You have to do things better than perfectly to get an A.

Dr. Watkins is a great professor and a lenient grader. The content of this class can be a bit repetitive because the way she does discussion boards is threaded rather than answering one unique question each week. The weekly quizzes and 4 tests are easy and you get 2 tries. There also was a broad-topic research paper that was really easy.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: Really easy and some of the material is actually interesting. Two attempts on the tests which is big help. Weekly discussion posts and quizzes which is simple; do have to read the textbook some esp. to do discussion posts but still easy. 1 paper but over any topic of your choice concerning gender. The material can be repetitive but overall not bad!

You'll have three projects, easy. The tests are open note, and she likes participation in lectures, so be prepared to answer questions. The tests will include some things that are only in the book.  Very good teacher, caring, you are graded on participation.

The course criteria is pretty basic and easy to navigate. The course load was not too heavy and not too light, there were weekly quizzes and discussion posts, a few assignments, a research paper, and the open note chpater exams. Does not offer extra credit, but as long as you do the work you'll be fine.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: She was a very interesting professor with very fun lectures. There were 2 papers overall but we had months to do them. The study guides are super helpful and the tests were open note. Honestly as long as you do some light reading on the concepts on the study guide and don't miss to many classes you'll get a great grade
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Dr. W is accessible outside of glass, you will have a couple papers to write in APA format. She is a pretty wonderful teacher, however, there are times when she starts to ramble a bit. She can always make time for her students if they need more help outside of class just be sure to contact her. If you need help, always ask.

She's a great professor. She explains the important things clearly and in a way that's easy to understand which makes an 8am not absolutely awful. She's pretty respectful about both sides during controversial topics. Attendance is mandatory too. You can use as many notes as you want on tests which helps a lot. Would 110% recommend to anyone.

There were four tests and all were open notes and had two attempts. There were 16 chapter quizzes, all open note and the lowest grade is dropped. Weekly discussion posts and the lowest grade is dropped. And two papers which she grades harshly but gives good feedback.

Not the best professor. These reviews are not accurate. Not very respectful towards other opinions or ideas. Gender and Sex class in which she spoke BADLY about men and their roles in society, made me beyond uncomfortable- and I'm a woman. Would not recommend

Dr. Watkins was overall a pretty easy professor and she is understanding. She does grades papers a little harshly, however she gives good feedback on them. Quizzes and tests are all open note, she also has discussions which are generally pretty easy; however I am not a fan of the way she does discussions, but she doesn't grade them harshly.

Easy A+ with minimal work. I took this class online and it was very interesting. Weekly open note quizzes. Her test are all open notes. I wouldn't be stressing about this class. Very understanding professor.

Professor is very easy to talk to, relatable, funny, and makes the lectures interesting. She is a great teacher and I liked PSYCH1101. She is great at helping students understand concepts. Attendance is mandatory. The tests are not hard and the assignments aren't either.

I put a medium amount of work in the class and showed up to lectures. I did not read the textbook, but pulled information from it for the study guide. Dr. Watkins is kind, easy to listen to, and you can tell she cares about your well-being. Definitely recommend her for intro to psychology.
She is a nice lady. Not always understanding. Attendance is mandatory. Lectures are very long but can be interesting. Big projects but if you start on time you will be ok.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Caring--Accessible outside class

comment: She is very friendly and makes all her lectures interesting. You can honestly get around the reading but you have to show up for class. She is kinda harsh with grading, very rarely gives out A's so not really worth going above and beyond with your projects just get it done. I don't really understand how she is grading things.

Do not take for a 4 week course. She has questions on exams that was no where in the materials. Her study guides were only 50% relevant for the tests. Really harsh paper grading without a clear rubric. I made an A but honestly I busted ass and it wasn't worth it.
Probably is good in a 15 week course but for a shortened class I was really unhappy.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: Pretty easy class. Schedule was flexible so work could be done any time throughout the week. She was friendly and helpful if needed. Had 4 tests that required Lockdown and webcam. Weekly quizzes didnt require webcam. Easy content to learn. Would definitely recommend to anyone and especially people with busy schedules.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment: One of the easiest professors I have ever had at Kennesaw State University. She truly cares about her students & goes above and beyond for them. Attendance is required so be prepared to be in class everyday but other than that, it was an amazing class! im taking her again this fall for one of my psych minor classes.

This class was pretty easy for me. There is one quiz and one discussion post due each week with a tests or writing assignment spread throughout the course. The workload was manageable for me and the criteria was clear.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: She has you take a quiz on the content before she lectures it, and her lectures aren't very helpful. You have to teach yourself and read the textbook. She rambles in her lectures and tries to make jokes instead of really teaching. She's very nice, gives study guides, open note quizzes, etc., but I didn't really learn anything from her lecture.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Dr. Watkins was a wonderful professor! She is so flexible when it came to assignments, and she was incredibly helpful. She responds to a text or email almost immediately. She has clear grading instructions for the two major writing assignments. Tests have a study guide, but it can be used during the exam! Uses Lockdown Browser. Easy online A!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria

comment: She is a nice professor but often gets distracted during class to the point where we won't get through the chapter. Her test are open note/textbook but you have to use a physical textbook since it's webcam. There is a text book quiz every week, 4 tests and a paper at the end of the semseter. Go to class is mandatory and a grade.

I love the gender class I'm taking with Dr. Watkins right now. She lets you use the physical book for the tests but no online resources (lockdown browser) so I HIGHLY suggest buying/renting the book. Our class discussions are great. Be aware, if you like to skip class don't take her because attendance is 15%. Other than that, an awesome choice.

I dropped this class before the first day. We were expected to do THREE graded assignments before we had even had a lecture. We were expected to know what textbook she uses without being given that info. Stated in her initial post that we should be putting 21 hours PER WEEK into the class. Take her if you want a part time job for a single class
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: I enjoyed the class. There were 4 tests, each had 50 questions, all open notes. There were 2 big assignments that were easy if you started early enough. She is accessible outside of class. The lectures were often interesting but fast because it is a beginning psych class and covers so much material. I recommend taking her!!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria

comment: She is a very good professor and knows her material very well. you can tell she loves teaching and im a nursing major but she makes psychology interesting! her tests are pretty hard but thats because theres a lot of material. make sure to read the book but her tests are open notes. Only 2 major assignments (easy) and 4 unit tests.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: This class was so interesting that I ended up buying the textbook. Dr. Watkins is super nice and will answer any questions you have. The only thing about her organization is that even if there is a big assignment due, you have to complete your normal weekly assignments that are due on the same day. Overall, I really enjoyed this class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: I took her at online at Oglethorpe. Very sweet and caring, yet lecture heavy. Quiz for every chapter in the textbook and we wrote two papers this semester. I wish we had the chance to get extra credit, but overall she is a good professor and I would recommend taking her

Dr. Watkins was an amazing and kind professor. I didn't study for any tests and had a 79 test average, but still got an A in the class. Make sure you follow instructions on the bigger writing assignments and you'll be fine. Throws out commonly missed questions on tests. Weekly discussions and quizzes aren't hard. Tests are open note and lockdown.

Dr. Watkins is awesome. She is so helpful and if you pay attention and she can tell you care she will do what she can to help you. Class didnt take more than should be expected at this level. Id say its an easy-ish A.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Accessible outside class--Lots of homework

comment: Easy online class. You need to put in effort, but overall easy A's. The quizzes and tests don't really relate to the ppt or reading, but still easy to do decent on. Two projects are easy, just space out the time you work on them. She is super helpful and caring. Her expectations are mostly clear, so do what she says and you'll be fine.
Good class. Attend and listen. Shes helpful and very responsive to emails.

She is so nice and cares about the students more than anything. The class is very easy and straightforward. Only the tests are a bit hard because they dont correlate with the information on cengage, rent the textbook if you can. Other than that, shes very understanding so take her!!

Overall this class was not bad as the course work is done through cengage. The tests on the other hand are open note, but the tests do not correlate close enough to the textbook itself. Just make sure to read and even maybe re-read the chapters for each test and you should be fine.

This was my fourth semester with her and all of her classes are set up the same no matter the class. There's 1 huge writing assignment and usually a smaller one. She alternates between 10 question quizzes and 1 page assignments every week. Attendence is counted but it's fine if you miss a couple of days. Book is important but tests open book w/ cam
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Get ready to read

comment: Lots of assignments to complete, but they are all very easy to complete. It was an online class so you had to have open webcam + lockdown browser while doing the tests. Tests are bit hard but she usually adds 4-8 points. Very sweet woman, she is ready to help students academically and personally.

Tough course - lots to read. You have to practically memorize the text book in order to do well on the tests - get a paper copy of the textbook. No electronics allowed in class. Two big papers to complete, overall not horrible and very insightful. Tells a lot of personal stories in class. Reads directly from ppt slides. Very nice and open to help.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: I took this class online and expected a lot of work but there were only 4 tests, 1 research paper, and homework assignments due every Sunday. As long as you put in the effort it is very easy to make an A in this class. I was taking 6 classes at once and this was my easiest class and I could keep up with it. TAKE HER!!
Probably my favorite teacher in college, she engages and gives great examples to help understand the class. Her classes aren't handed but she makes you want to learn.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Inspirational

comment: Love Mrs. K she is super nice and funny. But grades us on only a few big assignments and 4 tests.

I love professor Watkins! She was great and really loved her students. She is incredibly knowledgable about the subject and made class interesting. We had 4 tests, with that last one being the final and 2 major projects. Final was not cummulative. Her tests were easy and reading the textbook helps with the more detailed questions.
Online class was super easy. Just do the module each week and you should be fine. she doesn't take late work though!

I hated her. She laughs after every sentence she says and takes it personally if you leave class early. Wont send attendance sheet (10% of your grade) around until the end of class. No room to miss a day. Talks about personal life more than teaches. Exams are so hard she ends up dropping 1/4 of the questions anyways. No laptops in class.

One of the best professors I've ever had!! She is super sweet, and a really good teacher. I am really interested in the material, but she makes it easy to relate to and relates almost everything to something in real life. Take her!!

She is a really nice and easy professor. As long as you show up and listen to the lectures you will be fine. Tests are not difficult and assignments have clear instructions and grading guidelines. She also makes sure you know the info that will have an impact on you later in life no matter what your major is. Would take her again.
I loved her class! She's amazing, and an amazing professor. You will definitely get to walk away with something valuable.

Dr. Watkins is an amazing professor. Only 4 tests and the last one is technically your final, not cumulative. Easy in class and homework assignments. Only 3 writing assignments and only one is "hard." She really wants to help you succeed and gives great advice for college/grad school. Psych major or not it's a great class that you can relate to!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Professor Watkins is a very caring and understanding woman. The tests are very difficult but you keep up with readings, you won't have a problem. If the scores don't turn out very good, which is often, she curves the scores.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: Professor Watkins is by far the sweetest and most helpful professor I have ever taken. The tests are very difficult but if you just keep up with the readings, you'll better understand the word usage and material, but of course majority of the class didn't so the test grades weren't very good. No worries, she will curve the heck out of the scores.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY--Caring

comment: This was probably the most boring class I've ever taken. She's very nice and willing to help you, but the tests were RIDICULOUSLY difficult. So much that there were 20 point curves and people still did bad. You have to read a boring book & write a page on it, due each class.  Personally, I would avoid if I were you.

Very nice, helpful, and understanding. Difficult tests but understood the book used was at the PHD level so she redesigned the tests when the class didn't do well and curved them. Pay attention in class to complete easy 1 page HW. With effort you can earn a decent grade. Easy A? Look elsewhere. HW and group project will cushion your grade though.

Dr. Watkins is an amazing professor! Not only is she  funny, but she genuinely cares about you and your performance in class. Social psych is her area of expertise, so her enthusiasm for the subject made me enthusiastic about the class. I loved her and the class. I recommend her 100%. I hope to take more of her classes in the future.

Dr. Watkins is amazing and  I would definitely take her again. Though beware her class is tough and you have to put in work. If you like Psychology and want to actually learn something she is a great.

Dr. Watkins was my favorite teacher as a freshman at KSU. She is extremely understanding,intelligent, and she obviously cares about the subject matter. Although my class was in Critical Thinking and had a hard textbook to read, Dr. Watkins provided clear, concise, and elaborate answers to all student ?'s. I love her enthusiasm and way of thinking!
